thread.title: NWS: Sunny and chilly today in CT as dry stretch kicks off new year
thread.title_full: NWS: Sunny and chilly today in CT as dry stretch kicks off new year

author: Jessica Bravo
title: NWS: Sunny and chilly today in CT as dry stretch kicks off new year
text: Fayerweather Island Lighthouse on a sunny day in Bridgeport, Conn. The National Weather Service said Tuesday will be "a fine winter day by early January standards" ahead of dry week to start 2024 in Connecticut. A sunny and chilly day is expected Tuesday in Connecticut as a dry stretch is expected the first week of the new year, the National Weather Service said. Besides a "calm wind" that could start in the late afternoon into the night, the weather service said conditions will remain relatively fair. "Overall, (Tuesday will be) a fine winter day by early January standards," the NWS's Boston office said in a post on X . [Tuesday Forecast] a cold ðŸ¥¶start to the day with morning temperatures in the 20s, but rebounding to around 40 this afternoon. Very pleasant with abundant sunshine ðŸ˜Žand light winds. Overall, a fine #winter day by early January standards. #MAwx #RIwx #CTwx pic.twitter.com/p8cjWmQ4Yq The weather service said most of the state is expected to start cold, in the 20s, and end in the mid to upper 30s. Some areas of Connecticut could hit 40 degrees, the weather service said. According to the weather service, the rest of the week is expected to remain dry with similar conditions. Saturday night may bring a mix of snow and rain, which is the first day of the new year that may see precipitation, the weather service said.
